intro: Hieracium integrilaterum, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium integrilaterum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes.
